paragraphs.text: Sydney Hostage Crisis: Australia has lost its innocence.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Australia is known as the "lucky country."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was a phrase first coined in 1964 by social critic Donald Horne, and has come to represent the visceral feelings of both Australians, and visitors to the nation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It is seen as a reflection of a high standard of living, and a geographical insulation from the bad actors of the world theater
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But ten days out from Christmas, Australia has lost its innocence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On a day of brilliant blue skies, the terrorism of the post-9/11 world finally arrived on Australian soil
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: taking hold of city streets
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A man wielding a gun and an Islamic flag took customers and staff hostage at a cafe in central Sydney
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: As a native of Sydney, home for the holidays, safe and sound but shaken and furious, December 15 is a day that will forever be seared into my mind
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I've been to the Lindt Cafe
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: in fact
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I once worked across the street from it
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Emotions have run high here all day -- from fear to anger to a desire for vengeance
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I never expected this in Sydney
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The profoundly shocking standoff with all its disruptions to city life has struck fear in Sydneysiders, unaccustomed to these types of events
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The mood in Sydney is one of fear and uncertainty
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Until now, Australian authorities have been flawless in preventing terror attacks on Australian soil
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They have been aggressive in their pursuit of intelligence and would-be terrorists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: foiling plot after plot
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: September saw the biggest anti-terrorism operation in Australia's history
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: involving up to 800 police in coordinated raids
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: sparked by intelligence reports that Islamic State supporters were planning to seize a random member of the public and behead them live on camera
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it was inevitable that one would finally slip through the cracks
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Monday Sydney joined the ranks of cities such as New York, London and Madrid as the latest victim of what appears to be Islamic terrorism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Monday's distressing events have renewed Australians' concerns about Islamist objectives, and a growing Islamic presence in the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Some Australians recognize that this likely terrorist attack is a result of the poor immigration decisions of Australian governments, both conservative and liberal, over the last four decades
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A lack of liberty, an abandonment of reason, the imposition of Sharia on Muslims and non-Muslims, as well as the treatment of women are just some of the serious moral problems within the Muslim world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Islamist views are incompatible with the liberty enjoyed by Australians and Americans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Interestingly, Monday's events have also prompted Australians to revisit their gun laws
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With Islamic supremacism a mainstream interpretation of Islam, deeply rooted in Islamic scripture and endorsed by many of Islam's most influential scholars, Australians are beginning to understand the nature of the Islamic threat
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and studying their own weaknesses in its wake
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The United Kingdom has had two beheadings of members of the public in the last two years, with neither police nor civilians able to prevent it
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It also has prohibitive gun laws
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Australians are looking to America, and not the UK for guidance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With this sort of threat, the normal calculus of a civilized society with a small, armed (or unarmed) police force upon which the citizens are forced to rely, no longer adds up
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is unsurprising that home-grown terrorism is most rampant in nations with strict gun control
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is a reality that Australia's powerful anti-gun lobby seems to wish to ignore
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is times like these that Americans should be thankful for their Second Amendment, and crush any effort or force seeking to weaken or remove it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Right now, they are the envy of a growing number of Australians that wish they were armed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Australia will never be the same again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sydney just lost a little of its shine
paragraphs.label: assumption
